benchmark_details.name: CrisisHelpOffer
benchmark_details.overview: CrisisHelpOffer is a dataset of 101k tweets collaboratively labelled by generative LLMs and validated by humans, specifically designed to distinguish actionable content from noise during crises.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To identify actionable requests and offers shared on social media during crises.

data.source: Collaboratively labelled by generative LLMs and validated by human annotators.
data.annotation: Labels generated by LLMs and validated by human annotators.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is calculated based on the precision and recall of the model's predictions against the true labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Score indicates better performance in identifying actionable posts.
methodology.baseline_results: Models including BERT, RoBERTa, and CrisisTransformers were used as baselines.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through human evaluation with high agreement rates.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: To protect individualsâ€™ privacy, tweet contents that could identify individuals were masked.
